controller

Class YGOController

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.YGOController

  • public class YGOController
extends java.lang.Object
    YGOController is responsible for connecting listeners in Yu-Gi-Oh.fxml to variables in YuGiOhCollection. YGOController is also responsible for updating the ygo.txt file to be user for Yu-Gi-Oh.fxml's TableView.
    Author:
    Brenda Trejo

    • Constructor Detail

      • YGOController

        public YGOController()

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        initialize initializes the cells in Yu-Gi-Oh.fxml's TableView to their respective variables in the YuGiOhCollection. initialize also pre-populates the TableView with the data in ygo.txt.

      • backButtonHandle

        public void backButtonHandle()
        backButtonHandle is responsible for returning to Collectibase's main screen and saves any new entered information to ygo.txt before exiting.

      • updateButtonHandle

        public void updateButtonHandle()
        updateButtonHandle is responsible for updating Yu-Gi-Oh.fxml's TableView and ygo.txt whenever pressed.

      • insertButtonHandle

        public void insertButtonHandle()
        insertButtonHandle is responsible for inserting any text in Yu-Gi-Oh.fxml's TextFields onto the TableView. Empty cells are also accounted for. After the fields have been inserted they are cleared and ygo.txt is updated.

      • deleteButtonHandle

        public void deleteButtonHandle()
        deleteButtonHandle deletes a selected field or row from Yu-Gi-Oh.fxml's TableView. ygo.txt is also update by deleting the respective variable fields from the file.

      • cellValueFactory

        public void cellValueFactory()
        cellValueFactory is responsible for connecting the variable columns with it's respective variable in YuGiOhCollection. cellValueFactory also allows for a single cell to be edited when double clicked.

      • changeRarity

        public void changeRarity(javafx.scene.control.TableColumn.CellEditEvent<YuGiOhCollection,java.lang.String> edditedCell)
        8 The methods below updates a single variable of a collectible when it's cell is double clicked.
        Parameters:
        edditedCell: - the cell that was edited in Yu-Gi-Oh.fxml's TableView will be the variable that is changed in YuGiOhCollection.

      • changeCondition

        public void changeCondition(javafx.scene.control.TableColumn.CellEditEvent<YuGiOhCollection,java.lang.String> edditedCell)

      • changeValue

        public void changeValue(javafx.scene.control.TableColumn.CellEditEvent<YuGiOhCollection,java.lang.String> edditedCell)

        public void changeName(javafx.scene.control.TableColumn.CellEditEvent<YuGiOhCollection,java.lang.String> edditedCell)

      • changeCardType

        public void changeCardType(javafx.scene.control.TableColumn.CellEditEvent<YuGiOhCollection,java.lang.String> edditedCell)

      • changeAttack

        public void changeAttack(javafx.scene.control.TableColumn.CellEditEvent<YuGiOhCollection,java.lang.String> edditedCell)

      • changeDefense

        public void changeDefense(javafx.scene.control.TableColumn.CellEditEvent<YuGiOhCollection,java.lang.String> edditedCell)

      • changeSerialNumber

        public void changeSerialNumber(javafx.scene.control.TableColumn.CellEditEvent<YuGiOhCollection,java.lang.String> edditedCell)

      • writeYGOFile

        public void writeYGOFile()
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        writeYGOFile is responsible for writing to ygo.txt in order to update Yu-Gi-Oh.fxml's TableView.
        Throws:
        Exception: - In the case that the collection has not been previously created, the ygo.txt file is not found.
        java.lang.Exception
